channel.title: USB issue
channel.description: I inserted my USB and all my files where unvisible, I know that they weren't gone because there is space used when clicking properties. Anyways, I searched around what this was and how to get them visible again; I tried showing hidden folders and some cmd stuff i found googling but nothing worked. So I decided to format and now 3GB is just gone. It's a 32GB and there's only 29GB left now. I already know that I wont get that 3GB back, I'm just wondering if anyone knows whatthefuck happened. I'd like to know how 3GB magically can disappear.

item.title: USB issue
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Maybe you formatted it with a wrong setting. Click every button with the word ‘default’ in it.

Read full topic

item.title: USB issue
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Sorry, I posted from my phone and capitalisation is hard.

My media card is 2GB yet when I format it, there is only 1.83GB free.

http://pressf1.pcworld.co.nz/showthread.php?64865-Large-chunk-of-mysterious-used-space-after-format Read the post by “godfather”.

Read full topic

item.title: USB issue
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Ambokile:

It happens with most media storage, you don’t get the full size. I’m not sure why, but my phone’s memory card (for example) is only 1.83gb rather than 2gb

no I don’t mean like that,
what you say is normal, since 1.83 is GB(gigabyte) and 2 is Gb(gigabit)
from me it was actually 32 before and now it changed to 29 for some reason

Read full topic

item.title: USB issue
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

It happens with most media storage, you don’t get the full size. I’m not sure why, but my phone’s memory card (for example) is only 1.83gb rather than 2gb

item.title: USB issue
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

I inserted my USB and all my files where unvisible,
I know that they weren’t gone because there is space used when clicking properties.
Anyways, I searched around what this was and how to get them visible again;
I tried showing hidden folders and some cmd stuff i found googling but nothing worked.
So I decided to format and now 3GB is just gone.
It’s a 32GB and there’s only 29GB left now.
I already know that I wont get that 3GB back, I’m just wondering if anyone knows whatthefuck happened.
I’d like to know how 3GB magically can disappear.

Read full topic
